markdown:
Riding on a horse as black as night, the headless hunter known as the dullahan tracks down and takes the heads of those they deem unfit to continue living. When closing in for the kill, the dullahan first whispers their victim's name, then swiftly collects their prize, casting a pall of dread upon all who witness the grim execution. A dullahan manifests when a particularly violent warrior is beheaded and the warrior's soul stubbornly clings to material existence (or is refused entry to the afterlife). Most dullahans return to their former homelands, where they can exact vengeance on those they feel wronged them in life (or their living descendants). A dullahan's concept of justice is swift and merciless, and once they've selected a target, they're unwavering in their cause. Perhaps even more than revenge, a dullahan desires their own rotted head. An individual who wields the head of a dullahan is powerful indeed, for a dullahan will grudgingly serve such a master in the hopes of reclaiming their missing skull. Mighty fiends such as [devils](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=389) command dullahans to harvest souls or lead armies for them, while a mortal might use such an undead warrior to fulfill a personal vendetta. A dullahan won't hesitate to kill their liege and reclaim their head when the opportunity presents itself. **[Recall Knowledge - Undead](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=46)): DC 25 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 23 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 20 [Dullahan](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2964) **Source** [Monster Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=221) pg. 134 1.1 **Perception** +14; [lifesense](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=67) 60 feet **Languages** [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Necril](/Languages.aspx?ID=20) **Skills** [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +15, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +17, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +13, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=16) +15 **Str** +6 **Dex** +2 **Con** +2 **Int** +2 **Wis** +3 **Cha** +4 **Items** [Full Plate](/Armor.aspx?ID=13), _+1 [hatchet](/Weapons.aspx?ID=382)_, _+1 [longsword](/Weapons.aspx?ID=386)_ --- **AC** 28 **Fort** +13 **Ref** +15 **Will** +17 **HP** 95 ([fast healing 5](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=62)) **Immunities** bleed, [fear](/Traits.aspx?ID=598), [death](/Traits.aspx?ID=571) effects, [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=578), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=669), [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=85), [unconscious](/Conditions.aspx?ID=95) **Weaknesses** [holy](/Traits.aspx?ID=517) 5 **[Frightful Presence](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=64)** ([aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=542), [emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=590), [fear](/Traits.aspx?ID=598), [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=647)) 30 feet, DC 23
**[Reactive Strike](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=48)** --- **Speed** 20 feet **Melee** _keen longsword_ +18 ([Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [versatile P](/Traits.aspx?ID=200)), **Damage** 1d8+10 slashing **Melee** _keen returning hatchet_ +17 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Sweep](/Traits.aspx?ID=194)), **Damage** 1d6+10 slashing **Melee** fist +18 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Nonlethal](/Traits.aspx?ID=188)), **Damage** 1d4+10 bludgeoning **Ranged** _keen returning hatchet_ +14 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [thrown 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=195)), **Damage** 2d8+10 slashing **Head Hunter** Any slashing weapon gains the [_keen_](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2843) rune while a dullahan wields it, and any [hatchet](/Weapons.aspx?ID=382) they wield gains the [_returning_](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2845) rune as well. If the dullahan kills a creature with a critical hit using a slashing weapon, the target is decapitated as though the dullahan had used Reap on the target. **Reap** The dullahan removes the head of a dead creature within reach. Each creature within the area of the dullahan's frightful presence must attempt a new save, even if it is temporarily immune. **Summon Steed** ([Occult](/Traits.aspx?ID=120)) The dullahan summons a [war horse with elite adjustments](/Monsters.aspx?Elite=true&ID=268) and the [fiend](/Traits.aspx?ID=600) and [unholy](/Traits.aspx?ID=521) traits. This steed remains until it is slain, the dullahan Dismisses this effect, or the dullahan Summons a Steed again.
Dullahan Legends In Ustalav, residents recite legends of a cadre of dullahans who drive the “Coach of the Silent,” a macabre funeral carriage pulled by a team of spectral horses. To the west, among the Lands of the Linnorm Kings, Ulfen warriors whisper of dullahans who hunt down their victims using packs of hellish ebony hounds. And along the western coasts of Garund, pirates and merchants alike insist on the existence of a black-sailed ship crewed entirely by headless undead sailors.
name: Dullahan
